basic_information.scholarship_name: Frank Nelson Scholarship for Collaborative Piano
basic_information.college_name: College of Fine Arts and Design

description: This scholarship was established in 2013 by UCO alumnus and supporter Pat Bolt, a loyal contributor to multiple colleges and causes throughout our University. The scholarship was established to honor Dr. Frank Nelson. A member of the Central family for more than 25 years, Dr. Nelson personifies UCOs commitment to community by actively serving Edmonds seniors through volunteerism and leading worship music. Eligibility Any student in the Collaborative Piano program Enrolled Full-Time (12+ Hours Undergraduate, 9+ Hours Graduate) Sophomore, Junior, Senior or Graduate Student Requirements Personal Artist Statement (250 Words) Official Transcript

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship
